title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
description: This Act shall be called the Indian Penal Code, and shall extend to the whole of India.

title: Punishment of offences committed within India
description: Every person shall be liable to punishment under this Code and not otherwise for every act or omission contrary to the provisions thereof.

title: Punishment for offences committed beyond, but which by law may be tried within, India
description: Any person liable, by any law in force in India, to be tried for an offence committed beyond India shall be dealt with according to the provisions of this Code.

title: Extension of Code to extra-territorial offences
description: The provisions of this Code apply also to any offence committed by any citizen of India in any place without and beyond India.

title: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
description: Nothing in this Act shall affect any special or local law, or any special jurisdiction or power conferred by any other law for the time being in force.

title: Definitions in the Code to be understood subject to exceptions
description: Throughout this Code every definition of an offence, every penal provision, and every illustration of every such definition shall be understood subject to the exceptions contained in the Code.

title: Sense of expression once explained
description: Every expression which is explained in any part of this Code is used in every part of this Code in conformity with the explanation.

title: Gender
description: The pronoun 'he' and its derivatives are used of any person, whether male or female.

title: Number
description: Unless the contrary appears from the context, words importing the singular number include the plural number, and words importing the plural number include the singular number.

title: Man and Woman
description: The word 'man' denotes a male human being of any age; the word 'woman' denotes a female human being of any age.

title: Person
description: The word 'person' includes any Company or Association or body of persons, whether incorporated or not.

title: Public
description: The word 'public' includes any class of the public or any community.

title: Queen
description: The word 'Queen' is replaced with 'Government' in India.

title: Servant of Government
description: The words 'servant of the Government' denote any officer or servant continued, appointed, or employed in India by or under the authority of the Government.

title: Judge
description: The word 'Judge' denotes not only every person who is officially designated as a Judge but also every person who is empowered by law to give a definitive judgment in any legal proceeding.

title: Court of Justice
description: The words 'Court of Justice' denote a Judge who is empowered by law to act judicially alone, or a body of Judges.

title: Oath
description: The word 'Oath' includes a solemn affirmation substituted by law for an oath and any declaration required or authorized by law to be made before a public servant.

title: Death
description: The word 'Death' denotes the death of a human being unless the contrary appears from the context.

title: Voluntarily
description: A person is said to cause an effect 'voluntarily' when he causes it by means whereby he intended to cause it, or by means which, at the time of employing those means, he knew or had reason to believe to be likely to cause it.

title: Act
description: The word 'Act' denotes as well a series of acts as a single act.

title: Illegal
description: The word 'Illegal' is applicable to everything which is an offence or which is prohibited by law.

title: Movable property
description: The words 'movable property' are intended to include corporeal property of every description.

title: Wrongful gain
description: Wrongful gain is gain by unlawful means of property to which the person gaining is not legally entitled.

title: Dishonestly
description: Whoever does anything with the intention of causing wrongful gain to one person or wrongful loss to another person is said to do that thing 'dishonestly'.

title: Fraudulently
description: A person is said to do a thing fraudulently if he does that thing with intent to defraud but not otherwise.

title: Reason to believe
description: A person is said to have 'reason to believe' something if he has sufficient cause to believe that thing.

title: Property in possession of wife, clerk, or servant
description: When property is in the possession of a person’s wife, clerk, or servant, it is said to be in that person’s possession.

title: Counterfeit
description: A person is said to 'counterfeit' who causes one thing to resemble another with the intention to deceive.

title: Document
description: A 'document' is any matter expressed or described upon any substance by means of letters, figures, or marks.

title: Valuable security
description: A 'valuable security' is a document which is of financial importance.

title: A will
description: The words 'a will' denote any testamentary document.

title: Words referring to acts include illegal omissions
description: In every part of this Code, except where a contrary intention appears, words which refer to acts done extend also to illegal omissions.

title: Act, Omission
description: The word 'act' denotes as well a series of acts as a single act; the word 'omission' denotes as well a series of omissions as a single omission.

title: Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
description: When a criminal act is done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all, each of such persons is liable for that act in the same manner as if it were done by him alone.

title: When such an act is criminal by reason of its being done with a criminal knowledge or intention
description: Whenever an act, which is criminal only by reason of its being done with a criminal knowledge or intention, is done by several persons, each of such persons who joins in the act with such knowledge or intention is liable.

title: Effect caused partly by act and partly by omission
description: Wherever the causing of a certain effect, or an attempt to cause that effect, by an act or by an omission, is an offence, it is to be understood that the causing of that effect partly by an act and partly by an omission is the same offence.

title: Co-operation by doing one of several acts constituting an offence
description: When an offence is committed by means of several acts, whoever intentionally co-operates in the commission of that offence by doing any one of those acts, either singly or jointly with others, commits that offence.

title: Persons concerned in criminal act may be guilty of different offences
description: Where several persons are engaged in the commission of a criminal act, they may be guilty of different offences by means of that act.

title: Voluntarily
description: A person is said to cause an effect 'voluntarily' when he causes it by means whereby he intended to cause it, or by means which, at the time of employing those means, he knew or had reason to believe to be likely to cause it.

title: Offence
description: Except in the Chapters and sections mentioned in clauses 2 and 3 of this section, the word 'offence' denotes a thing made punishable by this Code.

title: Special law
description: A 'special law' is a law applicable to a particular subject.

title: Local law
description: A 'local law' is a law applicable only to a particular part of India.

title: Illegal, Legally bound to do
description: The word 'illegal' is applicable to everything which is an offence or which is prohibited by law.

title: Injury
description: The word 'injury' denotes any harm whatever illegally caused to any person, in body, mind, reputation or property.

title: Life
description: The word 'life' denotes the life of a human being, unless the contrary appears from the context.

title: Death
description: The word 'death' denotes the death of a human being unless the contrary appears from the context.

title: Animal
description: The word 'animal' denotes any living creature, other than a human being.

title: Vessel
description: The word 'vessel' denotes anything made for the conveyance by water of human beings or of property.

title: Year, Month
description: Wherever the word 'year' or the word 'month' is used, it is to be understood that the year or the month is to be reckoned according to the British calendar.

title: Section
description: The word 'section' denotes one of those portions of a Chapter of this Code which are distinguished by prefixed numeral figures.

title: Oath
description: The word 'oath' includes a solemn affirmation substituted by law for an oath.

title: Good faith
description: Nothing is said to be done or believed in 'good faith' which is done or believed without due care and attention.

title: Harbour
description: The word 'harbour' includes supplying a person with shelter, food, drink, money, clothes, arms, ammunition, or means of conveyance.

title: Punishments
description: The punishments to which offenders are liable under this Code are - (1) Death, (2) Imprisonment for life, (3) Imprisonment, (4) Forfeiture of property, (5) Fine.

title: Commutation of sentence of death
description: In every case in which sentence of death shall have been passed, the appropriate Government may, without the consent of the offender, commute the punishment for any other punishment provided by this Code.

title: Commutation of sentence of imprisonment for life
description: In every case in which sentence of imprisonment for life shall have been passed, the appropriate Government may, without the consent of the offender, commute the punishment for imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

title: Sentence of Europeans and Americans to penal servitude
description: Repealed.

title: Fractions of terms of punishment
description: In calculating fractions of terms of punishment, imprisonment for life shall be reckoned as equivalent to imprisonment for twenty years.

title: Offenders sentenced to transportation
description: Repealed.

title: Transportation instead of imprisonment
description: Repealed.

title: Sentence may be (in certain cases) of imprisonment wholly or partly rigorous or simple
description: In every case in which an offender is punishable with imprisonment which may be of either description, it shall be competent to the Court to direct that such imprisonment shall be either wholly rigorous or wholly simple, or that any part of such imprisonment shall be rigorous and the rest simple.

title: Sentence of forfeiture of property
description: Repealed.

title: Forfeiture of property in respect of offenders punishable with death, transportation, or imprisonment
description: Repealed.

title: Amount of fine
description: Where no sum is expressed to which a fine may extend, the amount of fine to which the offender is liable is unlimited, but shall not be excessive.

title: Sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
description: In every case of an offence punishable with imprisonment as well as fine, where the offender is sentenced to a fine, the Court may direct that in default of payment of the fine, he shall suffer imprisonment for a certain term.

title: Limit to imprisonment for non-payment of fine
description: The term for which the offender is sentenced to imprisonment in default of payment of a fine shall not exceed one-fourth of the term of imprisonment which is the maximum fixed for the offence.

title: Description of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
description: The imprisonment which the Court imposes in default of payment of a fine may be of any description to which the offender might have been sentenced for the offence.

title: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine, when offence punishable with fine only
description: If the offence is punishable with fine only, the imprisonment shall be simple, and the term shall not exceed two months when the fine does not exceed one hundred rupees, and in any other case shall not exceed six months.

title: Imprisonment to terminate on payment of fine
description: The imprisonment which is imposed in default of payment of a fine shall terminate whenever that fine is either paid or levied by process of law.

title: Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine
description: If, before the expiration of the term of imprisonment fixed in default of payment of the fine, the fine is paid or levied by process of law, the imprisonment shall terminate.

title: Fine leviable within six years, or during imprisonment
description: The fine, or any part thereof which remains unpaid, may be levied at any time within six years after the passing of the sentence.

title: Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences
description: Where anything which is an offence is made up of parts, each of which is an offence, the offender shall not be punished with a more severe punishment than prescribed.

title: Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences
description: In cases in which an act is criminal only if it is done with a particular intent or knowledge, the offender shall be punished accordingly.

title: Solitary confinement
description: Whenever any person is sentenced to rigorous imprisonment, the Court may, by its sentence, order that such person shall be kept in solitary confinement.

title: Limit of solitary confinement
description: In no case shall solitary confinement exceed fourteen days at a time, with intervals.

title: Enhanced punishment for certain offences after previous conviction
description: Whoever, having been convicted of an offence punishable with imprisonment of three years or more, is again convicted, shall be subject to enhanced punishment.

title: Act done by a person bound, or by mistake of fact believing himself bound, by law
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is, or who by mistake of fact and not by mistake of law, in good faith, believes himself to be, bound by law to do it.

title: Act of Judge when acting judicially
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by a Judge when acting judicially in the exercise of any power which is, or which in good faith he believes to be, given to him by law.

title: Act done pursuant to the judgment or order of Court
description: Nothing which is done in pursuance of, or warranted by, the judgment or order of a Court of Justice, if done whilst such judgment or order remains in force, is an offence, notwithstanding the Court may have had no jurisdiction to pass such judgment or order, provided the person doing the act in good faith believes that the Court had such jurisdiction.

title: Act done by a person justified, or by mistake of fact believing himself justified, by law
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by any person who is justified by law, or who by reason of a mistake of fact and not by reason of a mistake of law in good faith, believes himself to be justified by law, in doing it.

title: Accident in doing a lawful act
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by accident or misfortune, and without any criminal intention or knowledge in the doing of a lawful act in a lawful manner by lawful means and with proper care and caution.

title: Act likely to cause harm, but done without criminal intent, and to prevent other harm
description: Nothing is an offence merely by reason of its being done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause harm, if it be done without any criminal intention to cause harm, and in good faith for the purpose of preventing or avoiding other harm to person or property.

title: Act of a child under seven years of age
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by a child under seven years of age.

title: Act of a child above seven and under twelve of immature understanding
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by a child above seven years of age and under twelve, who has not attained sufficient maturity of understanding to judge the nature and consequences of his conduct on that occasion.

title: Act of a person of unsound mind
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, by reason of unsoundness of mind, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong or contrary to law.

title: Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will
description: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong or contrary to law, provided that the thing which intoxicated him was administered to him without his knowledge or against his will.

title: Offence requiring a particular intent or knowledge committed by one who is intoxicated
description: In cases where an act done is not an offence unless done with a particular knowledge or intent, a person who does the act in a state of intoxication shall be liable to be dealt with as if he had the same knowledge as he would have had if he had not been intoxicated, unless the thing which intoxicated him was administered to him without his knowledge or against his will.

title: Act not intended and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, done by consent
description: Nothing which is not intended to cause death, or grievous hurt, and which is not known by the doer to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt, is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause, or be intended by the doer to cause, to any person above eighteen years of age, who has given consent, whether express or implied, to suffer that harm; or by reason of any harm which it may be known by the doer to be likely to cause to any such person who has consented to take the risk of that harm.

title: Act not intended to cause death, done by consent in good faith for person's benefit
description: Nothing, which is not intended to cause death, is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause, or be intended by the doer to cause, to any person for whose benefit it is done in good faith, and who has given a consent, whether express or implied, to suffer that harm or to take the risk of that harm.

title: Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person, by or by consent of guardian
description: Nothing which is done in good faith for the benefit of a person under twelve years of age, or of unsound mind, by or by consent, either express or implied, of the guardian or other person having lawful charge of that person, is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause, or be intended by the doer to cause, or be known by the doer to be likely to cause to that person.

title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
description: A consent is not such a consent as is intended by any section of this Code, if it is given by a person under fear of injury, or under a misconception of fact, and if the person doing the act knows, or has reason to believe, that the consent was given in consequence of such fear or misconception.

title: Exclusion of acts which are offences independently of harm caused
description: The exceptions in sections 87, 88 and 89 do not extend to acts which are offences independently of any harm which they may cause, or be intended to cause, or be known to be likely to cause, to the person giving the consent.

title: Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent
description: Nothing is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause to a person for whose benefit it is done in good faith, even without that person’s consent, if the circumstances are such that it is impossible for that person to signify consent, or if that person is incapable of giving consent.

title: Communication made in good faith
description: No communication made in good faith is an offence by reason of any harm to the person to whom it is made, if it is made for that person’s benefit.

title: Act to which a person is compelled by threats
description: Except murder, and offences against the State punishable with death, nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is compelled to do it by threats which at the time of doing it reasonably cause the apprehension that instant death will otherwise be the consequence.

title: Act causing slight harm
description: Nothing is an offence by reason that it causes, or that it is intended to cause, or that it is known to be likely to cause, any harm, if that harm is so slight that no person of ordinary sense and temper would complain of such harm.

title: Things done in private defence
description: Nothing is an offence which is done in the exercise of the right of private defence.

title: Right of private defence of the body and of property
description: Every person has a right, subject to restrictions, to defend their own body and the body of any other person, and their own property.

title: Right of private defence against the act of a person of unsound mind
description: When an act, which would otherwise be a certain offence, is not an offence on account of the youth, unsoundness of mind, or intoxication of the person doing that act, every person has the same right of private defence against that act.

title: Acts against which there is no right of private defence
description: There is no right of private defence against acts which do not reasonably cause the apprehension of death or grievous hurt.

title: Right of private defence of the body
description: The right of private defence of the body extends, under restrictions, to causing death.

title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
description: If the offence be not of any of the descriptions enumerated in the last preceding section, the right of private defence of the body does not extend to the voluntary causing of death to the assailant, but does extend, under the restrictions mentioned in section 99, to the voluntary causing to the assailant of any harm other than death.

title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of the body
description: The right of private defence of the body commences as soon as a reasonable apprehension of danger to the body arises from an attempt or threat to commit the offence though the offence may not have been committed; it continues as long as such apprehension of danger to the body continues.

title: When the right of private defence of property extends to causing death
description: The right of private defence of property extends, under the restrictions mentioned in section 99, to the voluntary causing of death or of any other harm to the wrong-doer, if the offence, the committing of which, or the attempting to commit which, occasions the exercise of the right, be of the descriptions hereinafter enumerated.

title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
description: If the offence, the committing of which, or the attempting to commit which, occasions the exercise of the right of private defence, be not of any of the descriptions enumerated in the last preceding section, that right does not extend to the voluntary causing of death to the wrong-doer, but does extend, subject to the restrictions mentioned in section 99, to the voluntary causing to the wrong-doer of any harm other than death.

title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of property
description: The right of private defence of property commences when a reasonable apprehension of danger to the property commences. It continues as long as the offender continues the act which causes the apprehension of danger.

title: Right of private defence against deadly assault when there is risk of harm to innocent person
description: If in the exercise of the right of private defence against an assault which reasonably causes the apprehension of death, the defender cannot effectually exercise that right without risk of harm to an innocent person, his right extends to the running of that risk.

title: Abetment of a thing
description: A person abets the doing of a thing, who instigates any person to do that thing, or engages with one or more other persons in a conspiracy for doing that thing, or intentionally aids, by any act or illegal omission, the doing of that thing.

title: Abettor
description: A person who abets an offence is called an abettor.

title: Punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed in consequence
description: Whoever abets any offence shall, if the act abetted is committed in consequence of the abetment, and no express provision is made in this Code for the punishment of such abetment, be punished with the punishment provided for the offence.

title: Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention
description: Whoever abets the commission of an offence shall be liable for the punishment of that offence even if the person abetted commits the act with a different intention.

title: Liability of abettor when one act abetted and different act done
description: When an act is abetted and a different act is committed, the abettor is liable for the act done in the same manner and to the same extent as if he had directly abetted it.

title: Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment for act abetted and for act done
description: If the act for which the abettor is liable is itself an offence, the abettor shall be liable for the punishment of both offences.

title: Liability of abettor for an effect caused by the act abetted different from that intended by the abettor
description: When an act abetted causes an effect different from that intended, the abettor is liable for the effect caused, as if he intended that effect.

title: Abettor present when offence is committed
description: Whenever any person, who if absent would be liable to be punished as an abettor, is present when the act or offence for which he would be liable is committed, he shall be deemed to have committed such act or offence.

title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or life imprisonment if offence not committed
description: Whoever abets the commission of an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment, shall, if that offence is not committed, be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment, if offence not committed
description: Whoever abets the commission of an offence punishable with imprisonment shall, if the offence is not committed, be punished with imprisonment up to one-fourth of the longest term of such imprisonment.

title: Abetting commission of offence by the public or by more than ten persons
description: Whoever abets the commission of an offence by the public generally or by more than ten persons, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years and fine.

title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or life imprisonment
description: Whoever intending to facilitate an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment, voluntarily conceals the existence of a design to commit such offence, shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Public servant concealing design to commit offence which it is his duty to prevent
description: A public servant concealing the design to commit an offence which it is his duty to prevent, shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years.

title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
description: Whoever intending to facilitate an offence punishable with imprisonment voluntarily conceals the existence of a design to commit such offence, shall be punished with imprisonment up to one-fourth of the longest term.

title: Waging, or attempting to wage war, or abetting waging of war, against the Government of India
description: Whoever wages war against the Government of India, or attempts to wage such war, or abets the waging of such war, shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Collecting arms, etc., with intention of waging war against the Government of India
description: Whoever collects men, arms, or ammunition with the intention of waging war against the Government of India shall be punished with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to ten years and fine.

title: Concealing with intent to facilitate design to wage war
description: Whoever, by any act, conceals the existence of a design to wage war against the Government of India, shall be punished with imprisonment for life or up to ten years, and fine.

title: Assaulting President, Governor, etc., with intent to compel or restrain the exercise of lawful power
description: Whoever, with intent to compel or restrain the lawful exercise of any power by the President of India or any Governor, assaults or wrongfully restrains them, shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Sedition
description: Whoever brings or attempts to bring hatred, contempt, or excites disaffection towards the Government of India shall be punished with imprisonment for life or up to three years, with fine.

title: Waging war against any Asiatic power in alliance with the Government of India
description: Whoever wages war against any Asiatic power in alliance with the Government of India shall be punished with imprisonment for life or up to seven years and fine.

title: Committing depredation on territories of friendly power
description: Whoever commits depredation, or prepares to commit depredation, on the territories of any power at peace with India shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Receiving property taken by war or depredation mentioned in Sections 125 and 126
description: Whoever receives property taken by waging war against an Asiatic power or by committing depredation on friendly power shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of state or war to escape
description: Whoever, being a public servant and having custody of any state prisoner or prisoner of war, voluntarily allows them to escape shall be punished with imprisonment for life or up to ten years and fine.

title: Public servant negligently allowing prisoner of state or war to escape
description: Whoever, being a public servant and having custody of any state prisoner or prisoner of war, negligently allows them to escape shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years and fine.

title: Aiding escape of, rescuing or harbouring such prisoner
description: Whoever knowingly aids in the escape, rescue, or concealment of any prisoner of state or war shall be punished with imprisonment for life or up to ten years and fine.

title: Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor, or airman from his duty
description: Whoever abets mutiny or attempts to seduce any soldier, sailor, or airman from his duty shall be punished with imprisonment for life or up to ten years and fine.

title: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence thereof
description: Whoever abets the committing of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence, shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life and fine.

title: Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor, or airman on his superior officer
description: Whoever abets an assault by any soldier, sailor, or airman on his superior officer, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years and fine.

title: Abetment of such assault, if the assault is committed
description: If the abetment of assault on a superior officer results in actual assault, the abettor shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and fine.

title: Abetment of desertion of soldier, sailor, or airman
description: Whoever abets the desertion of any soldier, sailor, or airman shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years and fine.

title: Harbouring deserter
description: Whoever knowingly harbours a deserter from the armed forces shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years and fine.

title: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master
description: If a master of a merchant vessel negligently conceals a deserter, he shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or fine or both.

title: Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor, or airman
description: Whoever abets an act of insubordination by a soldier, sailor, or airman shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months and fine.

title: Persons subject to certain Acts
description: Persons subject to the Army Act, Navy Act, or Air Force Act are exempted from prosecution under IPC for offences against these laws.

title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor, or airman
description: Whoever, not being a soldier, sailor, or airman, wears any military uniform or carries a military token with intent to deceive, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months or fine or both.

title: Unlawful assembly
description: An assembly of five or more persons is designated as 'unlawful assembly' if their common object is to commit an offence or to resist execution of law.

title: Being member of unlawful assembly
description: Whoever, being aware that an assembly is unlawful, joins it, shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months or fine or both.

title: Punishment for being a member of an unlawful assembly
description: Whoever is a member of an unlawful assembly shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months or fine or both.

title: Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon
description: Whoever joins an unlawful assembly armed with a deadly weapon shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or fine or both.

title: Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly, knowing it has been commanded to disperse
description: Whoever knowingly joins an unlawful assembly after it has been ordered to disperse shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or fine or both.

title: Rioting
description: Whenever force or violence is used by an unlawful assembly, every member of such assembly is guilty of the offence of rioting.

title: Punishment for rioting
description: Whoever is guilty of rioting shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Rioting, armed with deadly weapon
description: Whoever is guilty of rioting, being armed with a deadly weapon, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object
description: If an offence is committed by any member of an unlawful assembly in prosecution of the common object, every member of such assembly is guilty of the offence.

title: Hiring, or conniving at hiring, of persons to join unlawful assembly
description: Whoever hires or engages any person to join an unlawful assembly shall be punished as if he had been a member of the unlawful assembly.

title: Knowingly joining or continuing in assembly of five or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse
description: Whoever knowingly joins or continues in an unlawful assembly after being ordered to disperse shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot
description: Whoever assaults or obstructs a public servant suppressing a riot shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot
description: Whoever provokes another to commit a riot shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, etc.
description: Whoever promotes enmity between groups on grounds of religion, race, or place of birth shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Owner or occupier of land on which an unlawful assembly is held
description: If the owner or occupier of land permits an unlawful assembly, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Liability of person for whose benefit a riot is committed
description: Whoever benefits from a riot shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Liability of agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit a riot is committed
description: Agents of owners or occupiers benefiting from a riot shall be punished similarly to the actual beneficiaries.

title: Harbouring persons hired for an unlawful assembly
description: Whoever harbours persons hired for an unlawful assembly shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot
description: Whoever is hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Affray
description: When two or more persons fight in a public place, they are said to commit an affray.

title: Punishment for committing affray
description: Whoever commits affray shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Repealed (Related to Public Servant Taking Gratification Other than Legal Remuneration)
description: This section was repealed and is no longer in force.

title: Repealed (Related to Public Servant Taking Gratification for Inducing Public Duty)
description: This section was repealed and is no longer in force.

title: Illegal gratification for exercise of personal influence with public servant
description: Whoever accepts gratification for exercising personal influence with a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Punishment for abetment by public servant of offences defined in Sections 162 or 163
description: A public servant abetting an offence under Sections 162 or 163 shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Repealed (Related to Public Servant Obtaining Valuable Thing Without Consideration)
description: This section was repealed and is no longer in force.

title: Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury to any person
description: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly disobeys any law with the intent to cause injury shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Public servant disobeying direction under law
description: If a public servant disobeys a direction of law relating to investigation of certain offences, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Punishment for non-treatment of victim
description: If a hospital in charge does not provide free treatment to a victim of rape or acid attack, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Public servant framing an incorrect document
description: Whoever, being a public servant, knowingly frames an incorrect document with intent to cause injury shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade
description: Whoever, being a public servant, engages in trade unlawfully shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property
description: Whoever, being a public servant, unlawfully buys or bids for property shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Personating a public servant
description: Whoever pretends to be a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent
description: Whoever wears a garb or carries a token used by a public servant with fraudulent intent shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or both.

title: Definitions relating to elections
description: This section defines terms related to elections, including 'candidate' and 'electoral right'.

title: Bribery in elections
description: Whoever gives or takes a bribe in connection with an election shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Undue influence at elections
description: Whoever interferes with the free exercise of electoral rights shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Personation at elections
description: Whoever votes as someone else at an election shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Punishment for bribery
description: Whoever commits bribery in an election shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Punishment for undue influence or personation at an election
description: Whoever commits undue influence or personation in an election shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: False statement in connection with an election
description: Whoever makes a false statement to influence an election shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Illegal payments in connection with an election
description: Whoever incurs or authorizes excessive election expenses shall be punished with fine up to ₹500.

title: Failure to keep election accounts
description: Whoever fails to keep election accounts properly shall be punished with fine up to ₹500.

title: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding
description: Whoever absconds to avoid being served with a legal document shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Preventing service of summons or other proceeding
description: Whoever prevents the serving of a legal document shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Non-attendance in obedience to an order from a public servant
description: Whoever fails to attend court or any other proceeding as required shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Omission to produce document to public servant by person legally bound to produce it
description: Whoever, being legally bound to produce a document, refuses to do so shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Omission to give notice or information to public servant
description: Whoever fails to give notice or information to a public servant as required shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Furnishing false information
description: Whoever knowingly provides false information to a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Refusing oath when duly required by public servant to take oath
description: Whoever refuses to take an oath when required by a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Refusing to answer a public servant authorized to question
description: Whoever refuses to answer a public servant authorized to question them shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Refusing to sign statement
description: Whoever refuses to sign a statement when required by law shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: False statement on oath or affirmation to public servant
description: Whoever makes a false statement on oath before a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: False information with intent to cause public servant to use his lawful power to the injury of another person
description: Whoever provides false information to a public servant with intent to cause harm shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Resistance to taking property by lawful authority
description: Whoever resists the lawful seizure of property shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority of public servant
description: Whoever obstructs the sale of lawfully seized property shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Illegal purchase or bid for property offered for sale by authority of public servant
description: Whoever illegally purchases or bids for property in a government sale shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine, or both.

title: Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
description: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any public servant in the discharge of his public functions shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine up to ₹500, or both.

title: Omission to assist public servant when bound by law to give assistance
description: Whoever, being legally bound to assist a public servant, fails to do so shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to ₹200, or both.

title: Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant
description: Whoever disobeys a public servant’s legally promulgated order shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine up to ₹1,000, or both.

title: Threat of injury to public servant
description: Whoever threatens a public servant to deter him from performing his duty shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection to public servant
description: Whoever threatens another person to prevent them from seeking protection from a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Giving false evidence
description: Whoever gives false evidence under oath shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fabricating false evidence
description: Whoever fabricates false evidence shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for false evidence
description: Whoever gives false evidence in a judicial proceeding shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence
description: If false evidence is given with intent to cause the conviction of someone for a capital offence, the offender shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment
description: Whoever gives false evidence to cause conviction for an offence punishable with life imprisonment shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Using evidence known to be false
description: Whoever knowingly uses false evidence shall be punished as if they gave or fabricated such evidence.

title: Issuing or signing false certificate
description: Whoever, being legally bound to give a certificate, issues a false certificate shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: Using as true a certificate known to be false
description: Whoever uses a false certificate as if it were true shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: False statement made in declaration which is by law receivable as evidence
description: Whoever makes a false statement in a declaration which is admissible as evidence shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Using as true such declaration knowing it to be false
description: Whoever uses a false declaration as true shall be punished in the same manner as if they made such a false statement.

title: Causing disappearance of evidence of offence, or giving false information to screen offender
description: Whoever causes the disappearance of evidence of an offence shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Intentional omission to give information of offence by person bound to inform
description: Whoever, being legally bound to inform about an offence, fails to do so shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
description: Whoever provides false information about an offence shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Destruction of document or electronic record to prevent its production as evidence
description: Whoever destroys a document or electronic record to prevent its use as evidence shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit or prosecution
description: Whoever falsely personates another in legal proceedings shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent its seizure
description: Whoever fraudulently removes or conceals property to prevent seizure shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Fraudulent claim to property to prevent its seizure
description: Whoever fraudulently claims property to prevent its seizure shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Fraudulently suffering decree for sum not due
description: Whoever fraudulently allows a decree to be passed for a sum not due shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Dishonestly making false claim in court
description: Whoever makes a false claim in court dishonestly shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Fraudulently obtaining decree for sum not due
description: Whoever fraudulently obtains a court decree for a sum not due shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: False charge of offence made with intent to injure
description: Whoever falsely charges any person with an offence, knowing that there is no just cause, shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Harbouring offender
description: Whoever harbours an offender with intent to screen him from legal punishment shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, or with fine, or both.

title: Taking gift to screen an offender from punishment
description: Whoever accepts any gratification to conceal an offence shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Offering gift to screen an offender from punishment
description: Whoever offers any gratification to screen an offender shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Taking gift to help in recovering stolen property
description: Whoever takes a reward for helping in recovering stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Harbouring an offender who has escaped from custody
description: Whoever knowingly harbours an escaped offender shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment
description: Whoever, being a public servant, disobeys the law to protect an offender shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Public servant framing incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment
description: Whoever, being a public servant, fabricates a false record to save someone from punishment shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Public servant in judicial proceeding corruptly making report contrary to law
description: Whoever, being a public servant, makes a corrupt report in judicial proceedings shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: Commitment for trial or confinement by a person having authority who knows that he is acting contrary to law
description: Whoever wrongfully commits a person for trial or confinement, knowing that it is unlawful, shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend
description: Whoever, being a public servant, deliberately omits to arrest an offender shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Intentional omission to apprehend on the part of public servant bound to apprehend person under sentence or lawfully committed
description: Whoever, being a public servant, deliberately omits to apprehend a sentenced person shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: Escape from confinement negligently suffered by public servant
description: Whoever, being a public servant, negligently allows a prisoner to escape shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Resistance or obstruction by a person to his lawful apprehension
description: Whoever resists or obstructs his own lawful arrest shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Resistance or obstruction to lawful apprehension of another person
description: Whoever obstructs the lawful arrest of another person shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Unlawful return from transportation
description: Whoever unlawfully returns to India after being transported shall be punished with imprisonment up to life or with rigorous imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Violation of condition of remission of punishment
description: Whoever violates the conditions of remission granted for a punishment shall be punished with the unexpired portion of the original sentence.

title: Intentional insult or interruption to public servant sitting in judicial proceeding
description: Whoever intentionally insults or disrupts a judicial proceeding shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine up to ₹1,000, or both.

title: Personation of a juror or assessor
description: Whoever fraudulently personates a juror or assessor shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Coin defined
description: The term 'coin' includes metal pieces lawfully issued by a government authority as money.

title: Counterfeiting coin
description: Whoever counterfeits coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting Indian coin
description: Whoever counterfeits Indian coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting coin
description: Whoever makes or sells instruments for counterfeiting coins shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Import or export of counterfeit coin
description: Whoever imports or exports counterfeit coins shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting coin
description: Whoever possesses instruments or materials for counterfeiting coins shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetting in India the counterfeiting outside India of coin
description: Whoever abets in India the counterfeiting of coin outside India shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Import or export of counterfeiting instruments or materials
description: Whoever imports or exports instruments or materials for counterfeiting coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Import or export of counterfeit Indian coin
description: Whoever imports or exports counterfeit Indian coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
description: Whoever, having knowledge that a coin is counterfeit, delivers it to another person shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of Indian coin as genuine, which is known to be counterfeit
description: Whoever delivers counterfeit Indian coin as genuine, knowing it to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of counterfeit coin by a person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
description: Whoever possesses counterfeit coin, knowing it to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Possession of counterfeit Indian coin by a person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
description: Whoever possesses counterfeit Indian coin, knowing it to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Import or export of counterfeit banknotes
description: Whoever imports or exports counterfeit banknotes shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of counterfeit banknotes
description: Whoever possesses counterfeit banknotes, knowing them to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possessing instruments or materials for forging banknotes
description: Whoever makes or possesses instruments or materials for forging banknotes shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulently diminishing weight of coin
description: Whoever fraudulently alters or diminishes the weight of any coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulently diminishing weight of Indian coin
description: Whoever fraudulently diminishes the weight of Indian coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of a different description
description: Whoever alters the appearance of a coin to make it pass as a different coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Altering appearance of Indian coin with intent that it shall pass as another Indian coin
description: Whoever alters the appearance of an Indian coin to make it pass as another Indian coin shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is altered
description: Whoever delivers an altered coin, knowing it to be altered, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of Indian coin possessed with knowledge that it is altered
description: Whoever delivers an altered Indian coin, knowing it to be altered, shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of altered coin by a person who knew it to be altered when he became possessed thereof
description: Whoever possesses an altered coin, knowing it to be altered, shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Possession of altered Indian coin by a person who knew it to be altered when he became possessed thereof
description: Whoever possesses an altered Indian coin, knowing it to be altered, shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Delivery of counterfeit government stamp
description: Whoever delivers counterfeit government stamps as genuine shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting government stamp
description: Whoever counterfeits government stamps shall be punished with imprisonment up to life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of counterfeit government stamp
description: Whoever possesses counterfeit government stamps, knowing them to be counterfeit, shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possessing instruments or materials for forging government stamps
description: Whoever makes or possesses instruments or materials for forging government stamps shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Using counterfeit government stamp
description: Whoever fraudulently uses counterfeit government stamps shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Having possession of counterfeit marked material
description: Whoever possesses counterfeit marked material with intent to use it fraudulently shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, or with fine, or both.

title: Using as genuine a government marked material known to be counterfeit
description: Whoever fraudulently uses counterfeit government marked material shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Effacing writing from substance bearing government mark
description: Whoever fraudulently removes writing from a government-marked substance shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Using as genuine a government-marked material from which mark has been removed
description: Whoever fraudulently uses a government-marked material with removed marks shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting government seal
description: Whoever counterfeits a government seal shall be punished with imprisonment up to life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Using as genuine a counterfeit government seal
description: Whoever fraudulently uses a counterfeit government seal shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulent use of false government seal
description: Whoever fraudulently uses a false government seal shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulent use of false weight or measure
description: Whoever fraudulently uses any false weight or measure shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Making or selling false weight or measure
description: Whoever makes or sells any false weight or measure shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Public nuisance
description: A person is guilty of a public nuisance if he does any act or is guilty of an illegal omission which causes common injury, danger, or annoyance to the public.

title: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
description: Whoever unlawfully or negligently does any act which is likely to spread an infection of any disease dangerous to life shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
description: Whoever malignantly does any act which is likely to spread infection of any disease dangerous to life shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Disobedience to quarantine rule
description: Whoever disobeys a quarantine rule shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale
description: Whoever adulterates any food or drink intended for sale shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Sale of noxious food or drink
description: Whoever sells any noxious food or drink shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Adulteration of drugs
description: Whoever adulterates any drug shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Sale of adulterated drugs
description: Whoever sells any adulterated drug shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Sale of drug as a different drug or preparation
description: Whoever knowingly sells a drug as a different drug shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir
description: Whoever corrupts or fouls water of a public spring or reservoir shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or both.

title: Making atmosphere noxious to health
description: Whoever voluntarily vitiates the atmosphere in any place so as to make it noxious to health shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or both.

title: Rash driving or riding on a public way
description: Whoever drives any vehicle rashly on a public way shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Rash navigation of a vessel
description: Whoever navigates any vessel rashly shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Exhibition of false light, mark or buoy
description: Whoever exhibits any false light, mark, or buoy shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: Conveying person by water for hire in unsafe or overloaded vessel
description: Whoever knowingly conveys any person by water for hire in an unsafe or overloaded vessel shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or both.

title: Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation
description: Whoever causes danger or obstruction in any public way or navigation line shall be punished with fine up to two hundred rupees.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance
description: Whoever negligently conducts any act with a poisonous substance shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter
description: Whoever negligently conducts any act with fire or combustible matter shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance
description: Whoever negligently conducts any act with an explosive substance shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery
description: Whoever negligently conducts any act with machinery shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down or repairing buildings
description: Whoever negligently conducts any act while pulling down or repairing buildings shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Negligent conduct with respect to animals
description: Whoever negligently conducts any act with an animal shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Punishment for public nuisance
description: Whoever commits a public nuisance shall be punished with fine up to two hundred rupees.

title: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue
description: Whoever continues a nuisance after an injunction to discontinue shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine, or both.

title: Sale of obscene books, etc.
description: Whoever sells, distributes, or exhibits obscene books shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Sale of obscene objects to young persons
description: Whoever sells obscene objects to young persons shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Obscene acts and songs
description: Whoever commits obscene acts in public places shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or both.

title: Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion
description: Whoever defiles a place of worship shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Disturbing religious assembly
description: Whoever voluntarily disturbs a religious assembly shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Trespassing on burial places, etc.
description: Whoever, with the intention of wounding the feelings of any person, trespasses on any place of worship or burial ground shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Uttering words with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings
description: Whoever, with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings, utters any word or makes any sound shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Culpable homicide
description: Whoever causes death by doing an act with the intention of causing death, or with the intention of causing bodily injury as is likely to cause death, commits culpable homicide.

title: Murder
description: Culpable homicide is murder if the act is done with the intention of causing death, or causing bodily injury which is sufficient to cause death.

title: Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended
description: If a person causes death intending to kill another, it is still culpable homicide, even if someone else dies instead.

title: Punishment for murder
description: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for murder by a life convict
description: Whoever, being under sentence of life imprisonment, commits murder shall be punished with death.

title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
description: Whoever commits culpable homicide not amounting to murder shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
description: Whoever abets the suicide of a child, insane, or intoxicated person shall be punished with death or life imprisonment, or imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abetment of suicide
description: If any person abets the commission of suicide, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Attempt to murder
description: Whoever does any act with the intention of causing death, and in such an attempt causes harm, shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Attempt to commit culpable homicide
description: Whoever does any act with the intention of causing death but which does not amount to murder, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Attempt to commit suicide
description: Whoever attempts to commit suicide shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Thug
description: Whoever is habitually associated with committing robbery or kidnapping with murder is called a thug and shall be punished with imprisonment for life.

title: Punishment of a thug
description: Whoever is a thug shall be punished with imprisonment for life.

title: Causing miscarriage
description: Whoever causes a woman to miscarry, except in good faith for the purpose of saving her life, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Causing miscarriage without woman's consent
description: Whoever causes a woman to miscarry without her consent shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage
description: Whoever does an act to cause miscarriage that results in death shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive
description: Whoever does an act to prevent a child from being born alive shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, or with fine, or both.

title: Causing death of quick unborn child by act amounting to culpable homicide
description: Whoever does any act amounting to culpable homicide that causes the death of an unborn child shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years by parent or person having care
description: Whoever exposes or abandons a child under twelve years of age shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or both.

title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
description: Whoever secretly buries or otherwise disposes of the dead body of a child shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Hurt
description: Whoever causes bodily pain, disease, or infirmity to any person is said to cause hurt.

title: Grievous hurt
description: Grievous hurt includes emasculation, permanent loss of sight, loss of limb, disfigurement, bone fracture, or severe bodily pain for twenty days or more.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt using a dangerous weapon or means shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt
description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means
description: Whoever, except in self-defense, voluntarily causes grievous hurt using a dangerous weapon or means shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property or confession
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to extort property or a confession shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Causing hurt by means of poison, etc., with intent to commit an offence
description: Whoever administers poison or any harmful substance with intent to commit an offence shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act
description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt for extortion shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to extort a confession shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession, or to compel restoration of property
description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to extort a confession shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to deter a public servant from duty shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty
description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to deter a public servant from duty shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt on provocation
description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt on grave provocation shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to five hundred rupees, or both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt on grave provocation shall be punished with imprisonment up to four years, or with fine, or both.

title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others
description: Whoever acts rashly or negligently to endanger human life shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine up to two hundred and fifty rupees, or both.

title: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
description: Whoever causes hurt by a rash or negligent act shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine up to five hundred rupees, or both.

title: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
description: Whoever causes grievous hurt by a rash or negligent act shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine up to one thousand rupees, or both.

title: Wrongful restraint
description: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to five hundred rupees, or both.

title: Wrongful confinement
description: Whoever wrongfully confines any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine up to one thousand rupees, or both.

title: Punishment for wrongful restraint
description: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to five hundred rupees, or both.

title: Punishment for wrongful confinement
description: Whoever wrongfully confines any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine up to one thousand rupees, or both.

title: Wrongful confinement for three or more days
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person for three or more days shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
