description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person for ten or more days shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person for whose liberation a writ has been issued shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement in secret
description: Whoever wrongfully confines any person in secret shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort property, or constrain to illegal act
description: Whoever wrongfully confines any person to extort property or compel an illegal act shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort confession, or compel restoration of property
description: Whoever wrongfully confines any person to extort a confession or compel restoration of property shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Force
description: A person is said to use force if they cause motion, change of motion, or cessation of motion in another person by bodily power.

title: Criminal force
description: Whoever intentionally uses force on another person, intending to cause harm or fear, is said to use criminal force.

title: Assault
description: Whoever makes any gesture or preparation intending or knowing it to be likely to cause another person to apprehend that they will use criminal force against that person is said to commit an assault.

title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any person otherwise than on grave provocation shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine up to five hundred rupees, or both.

title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to deter a public servant from discharging their duty shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any woman, intending to outrage her modesty, shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment
description: A man committing unwelcome and explicit sexual advances, or physical contact involving unwelcome and explicit sexual overtures, shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or both.

title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to any woman intending to disrobe her shall be punished with imprisonment not less than three years but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voyeurism
description: Whoever watches or captures the image of a woman engaging in a private act shall be punished with imprisonment from one to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Stalking
description: Whoever follows a woman and contacts or attempts to contact her despite clear disinterest shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonor person, otherwise than on grave provocation
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force, intending to dishonor a person, shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or both.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to commit theft of property being carried by a person shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to wrongfully confine any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or both.

title: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force on grave provocation shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to two hundred rupees, or both.

title: Kidnapping
description: Kidnapping is of two kinds: kidnapping from India and kidnapping from lawful guardianship.

title: Kidnapping from India
description: Whoever conveys any person beyond the limits of India without their consent shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping from lawful guardianship
description: Whoever takes a minor (under 16 for males, under 18 for females) from the lawful guardianship without consent shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Abduction
description: Whoever by force compels, or by deceitful means induces, any person to go from any place is said to abduct that person.

title: Punishment for kidnapping
description: Whoever kidnaps any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person with the intent to murder shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping for ransom, etc.
description: Whoever kidnaps any person for ransom shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting with intent to secretly and wrongfully confine person
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person with the intent to secretly and wrongfully confine them shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage, etc.
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any woman with intent to compel her marriage shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Procuration of minor girl
description: Whoever induces a minor girl to go from any place with intent that she may be forced into illicit intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting to subject person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person with the intent to cause grievous hurt or subject them to slavery shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement a kidnapped person
description: Whoever keeps a kidnapped or abducted person in wrongful confinement shall be punished with the same punishment as if they had kidnapped or abducted that person.

title: Kidnapping or abducting child under ten years with intent to steal from its person
description: Whoever kidnaps any child under ten years intending to steal from the child shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Trafficking of persons
description: Whoever traffics a person for exploitation shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Habitual dealing in slaves
description: Whoever habitually imports, exports, removes, buys, sells, or disposes of any person as a slave shall be punished with imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Selling minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
description: Whoever sells, lets to hire, or otherwise disposes of any person under the age of 18 years with intent that such person shall be employed for immoral purposes shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Buying minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
description: Whoever buys, hires, or otherwise obtains possession of any person under the age of 18 years with intent that such person shall be employed for immoral purposes shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Unlawful compulsory labour
description: Whoever unlawfully compels any person to labour against their will shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year or with fine or with both.

title: Rape
description: A man is said to commit rape if he engages in sexual intercourse with a woman against her will, without her consent, by coercion, or under false pretenses.

title: Punishment for Rape
description: Whoever commits rape shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment of not less than 10 years, which may extend to life imprisonment, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for causing death or resulting in persistent vegetative state of victim
description: If rape results in death or the victim being in a persistent vegetative state, the offender shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for 20 years or for life, or with death.

title: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation
description: A husband who has sexual intercourse with his wife without her consent while they are living separately shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Sexual intercourse by a person in authority
description: A person in a position of authority who abuses their power to obtain sexual intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment of 5-10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Gang rape
description: If a woman is raped by one or more persons acting in furtherance of a common intention, each of them shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment of not less than 20 years, which may extend to life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for repeat offenders
description: Repeat offenders convicted under sections 376, 376A, 376D shall be punished with life imprisonment or the death penalty.

title: Unnatural offences
description: Whoever voluntarily has carnal intercourse against the order of nature with any man, woman, or animal shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft
description: Whoever, intending to take dishonestly any movable property out of the possession of any person without that person’s consent, moves that property, is said to commit theft.

title: Punishment for Theft
description: Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Theft in dwelling house, etc.
description: Whoever commits theft in any building, tent, or vessel used as a human dwelling shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master
description: A servant or clerk committing theft of property belonging to their employer shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft after preparation made for causing death, hurt or restraint
description: If a person commits theft after making preparations to cause death, hurt, or restraint, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Extortion
description: Whoever intentionally puts another person in fear of injury to dishonestly induce them to deliver property or valuable security is said to commit extortion.

title: Punishment for extortion
description: Whoever commits extortion shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Putting person in fear of injury to commit extortion
description: Whoever puts or attempts to put any person in fear of injury to commit extortion shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt
description: Whoever commits extortion by putting any person in fear of death or grievous hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Putting person in fear of death or grievous hurt in order to commit extortion
description: Whoever, to commit extortion, puts another person in fear of death or grievous hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment
description: Whoever commits extortion by threatening to accuse someone of an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Putting person in fear of accusation of offence to commit extortion
description: Whoever, to commit extortion, puts another person in fear of being accused of an offence shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Robbery
description: In all robbery, there is either theft or extortion. Theft becomes robbery if, in order to commit the theft, the offender voluntarily causes or attempts to cause death, hurt, or wrongful restraint.

title: Dacoity
description: When five or more persons conjointly commit or attempt to commit robbery, it is called dacoity.

title: Punishment for Robbery
description: Whoever commits robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Attempt to commit robbery
description: Whoever attempts to commit robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery
description: If the offender in committing robbery voluntarily causes hurt, they shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for Dacoity
description: Whoever commits dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dacoity with murder
description: If any one of five or more persons committing dacoity commits murder, every one of them shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Robbery or dacoity with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt
description: If, at the time of committing robbery or dacoity, the offender attempts to cause death or grievous hurt, they shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment not less than seven years.

title: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon
description: If, at the time of attempting to commit robbery or dacoity, the offender is armed with a deadly weapon, they shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment not less than seven years.

title: Making preparation to commit dacoity
description: Whoever makes preparation to commit dacoity shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Belonging to gang of dacoits
description: Whoever belongs to a gang of dacoits shall be punished with imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for belonging to gang of thieves
description: Whoever belongs to a gang of thieves shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assembling for purpose of committing dacoity
description: Whoever assembles with five or more persons for committing dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonest misappropriation of property
description: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates or converts to their own use any movable property shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonest misappropriation of property of deceased person
description: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates the property of a deceased person shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal breach of trust
description: Whoever is entrusted with property and dishonestly misappropriates it shall be punished under this section.

title: Punishment for criminal breach of trust
description: Whoever commits criminal breach of trust shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal breach of trust by carrier, wharfinger, etc.
description: If a carrier, wharfinger, or warehouse-keeper commits a criminal breach of trust, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant
description: If a clerk or servant commits a criminal breach of trust, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal breach of trust by public servant, banker, merchant or agent
description: If a public servant, banker, merchant, or agent commits a criminal breach of trust, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to life or up to ten years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Stolen property
description: Property that has been obtained through theft, extortion, or robbery is considered stolen property.

title: Dishonestly receiving stolen property
description: Whoever dishonestly receives or retains stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonestly receiving property stolen in the commission of a dacoity
description: Whoever dishonestly receives property stolen during dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment up to life or up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Habitually dealing in stolen property
description: Whoever habitually receives or deals in stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment up to life or up to 10 years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assisting in concealment of stolen property
description: Whoever assists in concealing stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Cheating
description: Whoever fraudulently deceives someone to deliver property or valuable security shall be guilty of cheating.

title: Cheating by personation
description: Whoever cheats by pretending to be someone else shall be punished under this section.

title: Punishment for cheating
description: Whoever cheats shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Cheating with knowledge that wrongful loss may ensue to a person
description: Whoever cheats knowing that wrongful loss may be caused to someone shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for cheating by personation
description: Whoever cheats by personation shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
description: Whoever cheats and dishonestly induces someone to deliver property shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors
description: Whoever fraudulently removes or conceals property to prevent it from being distributed among creditors shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonestly preventing debt being available for creditors
description: Whoever dishonestly prevents a debt from being available for creditors shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer
description: Whoever fraudulently executes a deed of transfer with dishonest intent shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property
description: Whoever dishonestly removes or conceals property shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief
description: Whoever intentionally causes damage to another’s property with intent to cause wrongful loss or destruction shall be guilty of mischief.

title: Punishment for mischief
description: Whoever commits mischief shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief causing damage of fifty rupees or more
description: Whoever commits mischief and causes damage of fifty rupees or more shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by killing or maiming animal of value ten rupees or more
description: Whoever kills or maims any animal worth ten rupees or more shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by killing or maiming cattle, etc.
description: Whoever kills or maims cattle, elephant, or any animal worth fifty rupees or more shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by causing diminution of water supply
description: Whoever commits mischief by diverting or obstructing water supply shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, river, or navigation
description: Whoever commits mischief by causing damage to public road, bridge, river, or navigation shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage
description: Whoever commits mischief by causing flooding or obstruction to drainage shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by destroying landmark fixed by public authority
description: Whoever commits mischief by destroying a landmark fixed by public authority shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by destroying or moving milestone or direction post
description: Whoever commits mischief by destroying or moving a milestone or direction post shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to cause damage
description: Whoever commits mischief by fire or explosive substance and causes damage shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house
description: Whoever commits mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy a house shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief with intent to destroy vessel
description: Whoever commits mischief with intent to destroy or endanger a vessel shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy forest
description: Whoever commits mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy a forest shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for mischief described in Section 437 and 438
description: Whoever commits mischief as described in Section 437 or 438 shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief committed after preparation for causing death or hurt
description: Whoever commits mischief after preparation for causing death or hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal trespass
description: Whoever enters or remains on property unlawfully to commit an offence shall be guilty of criminal trespass.

title: House-trespass
description: Whoever commits criminal trespass into a house or building shall be guilty of house-trespass.

title: Lurking house-trespass
description: Whoever commits house-trespass secretly shall be guilty of lurking house-trespass.

title: Lurking house-trespass by night
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass at night shall be guilty under this section.

title: House-breaking
description: Whoever commits house-trespass by breaking in shall be guilty of house-breaking.

title: House-breaking by night
description: Whoever commits house-breaking at night shall be guilty under this section.

title: Punishment for criminal trespass
description: Whoever commits criminal trespass shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for house-trespass
description: Whoever commits house-trespass shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: House-trespass to commit an offence punishable with death
description: Whoever commits house-trespass with intent to commit an offence punishable with death shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment for life
description: Whoever commits house-trespass with intent to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment for life shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment
description: Whoever commits house-trespass with intent to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
description: Whoever commits house-trespass after preparation to cause hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking with intent to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking after preparation for causing hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass by night
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Lurking house-trespass by night to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night with intent to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment shall be punished with imprisonment up to fourteen years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night after preparation for hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night after preparation for causing hurt, assault, or wrongful restraint shall be punished with imprisonment up to fourteen years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Grievous hurt caused while committing house-trespass
description: Whoever causes grievous hurt while committing house-trespass shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass resulting in death
description: If death is caused while committing house-trespass, every participant shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonestly breaking open a receptacle containing property
description: Whoever dishonestly breaks open any receptacle containing property shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for breach of trust by carrier
description: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates goods entrusted to them as a carrier shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Forgery
description: Whoever makes any false document with intent to cause damage or injury shall be guilty of forgery.

title: Making a false document
description: Whoever fraudulently makes or alters a document to make it appear genuine shall be guilty under this section.

title: Punishment for forgery
description: Whoever commits forgery shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Forgery of record of Court or of public register
description: Whoever forges a document related to a court or public register shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery of valuable security, will, etc.
description: Whoever forges a valuable security, will, or any document related to a financial transaction shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery for cheating
description: Whoever forges a document with intent to cheat shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery for harming reputation
description: Whoever forges a document to harm someone's reputation shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forged document
description: A document made fraudulently to appear genuine is a forged document.

title: Using as genuine a forged document
description: Whoever fraudulently uses a forged document as genuine shall be punished in the same manner as if they had forged the document.

title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, plate, etc., with intent to commit forgery
description: Whoever makes or possesses any counterfeit seal, plate, or document for forgery shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, plate, etc., for purpose of committing forgery punishable otherwise
description: Whoever makes or possesses any counterfeit seal, plate, or document for forgery in a manner not covered under Section 472 shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Possession of forged document with intent to use it as genuine
description: Whoever possesses a forged document with intent to use it as genuine shall be punished with the same punishment as if they had forged the document.

title: Possession of a forged document described in Section 466 or 467
description: Whoever possesses a forged document as described in Section 466 or 467 shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents
description: Whoever counterfeits a device or mark used for authenticating documents shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulent cancellation, destruction, etc., of valuable security
description: Whoever fraudulently cancels, destroys, or alters a valuable security shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Repealed
description: This section has been repealed.

title: Repealed
description: This section has been repealed.

title: Repealed
description: This section has been repealed.

title: Using a false property mark
description: Whoever uses a false property mark shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for using a false property mark
description: Whoever counterfeits or uses a false property mark shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Counterfeiting a property mark
description: Whoever counterfeits a property mark used by another person shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Counterfeiting a mark used by a public servant
description: Whoever counterfeits a mark used by a public servant shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Possession of an instrument for counterfeiting a property mark
description: Whoever possesses any instrument for counterfeiting a property mark shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Selling goods marked with a counterfeit property mark
description: Whoever sells goods with a counterfeit property mark shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Making a false mark upon any receptacle containing goods
description: Whoever marks a false mark upon any receptacle containing goods shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for making use of any false mark
description: Whoever makes use of any false mark shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Tampering with property marks
description: Whoever tampers with a property mark shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Repealed
description: This section has been repealed.

title: Breach of contract to attend on and supply wants of helpless person
description: Whoever breaches a contract to attend on or supply the wants of a helpless person shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine, or with both.

title: Breach of contract to serve at a distant place
description: Whoever breaches a contract to serve at a distant place shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Cohabitation caused by a man deceitfully inducing a belief of lawful marriage
description: Whoever deceives a woman into believing that she is lawfully married to him and causes her to cohabit shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife
description: Whoever marries again during the lifetime of a husband or wife shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Concealment of former marriage
description: Whoever conceals a former marriage and remarries shall be punished with imprisonment up to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulent marriage ceremony
description: Whoever fraudulently goes through a marriage ceremony without lawful marriage shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Repealed
description: This section has been repealed.

title: Enticing or taking away a married woman
description: Whoever entices or takes away a married woman shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Cruelty by husband or relatives
description: Whoever subjects a woman to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Defamation
description: Whoever makes or publishes an imputation intending to harm a person's reputation shall be guilty of defamation.

title: Punishment for defamation
description: Whoever defames another shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Printing or engraving matter known to be defamatory
description: Whoever prints or engraves any defamatory matter knowing that it is defamatory shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter
description: Whoever sells or offers for sale any printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal intimidation
description: Whoever threatens another with injury to body, reputation, or property with intent to cause alarm shall be punished under this section.

title: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace
description: Whoever intentionally insults another, knowing it may provoke a breach of the peace, shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Statements conducing to public mischief
description: Whoever makes, publishes, or circulates any statement with intent to incite public mischief shall be punished under this section.

title: Punishment for criminal intimidation
description: Whoever commits the offense of criminal intimidation shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both. If the threat is to cause death or grievous hurt, the punishment may extend to seven years.

title: Criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication
description: Whoever commits criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, in addition to the punishment under Section 506.

title: Act caused by inducing a person to believe that he will be rendered an object of divine displeasure
description: Whoever induces another to do any act by making them believe that they will suffer divine displeasure shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Word, gesture, or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
description: Whoever utters any word or makes any gesture intending to insult the modesty of a woman shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Misconduct in public by a drunken person
description: Whoever, in a state of intoxication, appears in a public place and causes annoyance shall be punished with imprisonment up to twenty-four hours, or with fine up to ten rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for attempting to commit offenses punishable with life imprisonment or other imprisonment
description: Whoever attempts to commit an offense punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment shall, unless otherwise provided, be punished with imprisonment for half of the term of the intended offense.
